title: Unprofessional
text:
The app sends way too many notifications. Like WAY WAY too many. I’ve turned off every notification type in the app and I still get at least 5 notifications every day; none of them are relevant or interesting to me. 

The main feed is also full of click bait, worthless stories and videos. The comment sections are full of bots. Overall the app feels so unprofessional and annoying to use. I only keep it because employers insist on checking my LinkedIn for hiring.

title: Premium is a scam
text: I canceled this service and was resubscribed by I tunes when I updated my payment method. Then LinkedIn customer service refused to cancel the service pointing fingers at I Tunes making me wait 30 days to cancel so they can scam me out of monthly payment fees. Canceling my LinkedIn membership.

title: IOS app needs work
text: I love linkedin and have been using it for years but the app performance has proven to be pretty slow and often times buggy. It will often get stuck on certain sections and will be unresponsive for a few seconds until i close the app and start over.

title: Here for jobs not socializing
text: Why has this turned into a weird mix of twitter, ig, and facebook? in here for a job not to scroll on the TL

title: Age
text: The age says age 12+ I am 14 years old, the legal age to work in my state. I tried to sign up for the app, I put in my birthdate and apparently I didn’t meet the age requirement. Please update your age requirements on the Apple App Store.

title: Fed up
text: I’m getting tired of being restricted on your site. I have done nothing wrong. I don’t post anything obscene or inappropriate. Yet you have me locked out again. If I ever get back into my account, I might just delete it. You’re almost as bad as facebook or Instagram! One person gets butthurt and they cry like a baby.

title: That’s so awful
text:
Recently when I scrolled in LinkedIn app, the app is freezing and didn’t work at all, I should close and try again 
Please check it out!

title: Buggy version
text:
I can not open any file when I click on it. 
Also, the app is crashed when I search using three words or above.

title: STOP THE AUTO REFRESH!!!!!
text:
I’ll be in the middle of reading a post or looking someone up or making my way through my feed… need to leave for a few minuets… come back and watch it all poof away as the app refreshes. LEAVE IT SO I CAN PICK UP WHERE I LEFT OFF. So frustrating.

Update ^^ same. STOP AUTO REFRESH so I can continue where I was.

title: Got restricted for no reason and unable to verify account with international ID
text: I haven’t had any unusual activities recently but my account was suddenly restricted right before my big interviews. I was asked to verify it but I couldn’t because I have an international ID. I have over 700 connections on LinkedIn and it’s my main professional appearance so I really don’t know what to do at the moment.

title: Creating bad habits, disincentivizing networking
text:
The “add to connection -> message” flow is awful now that you’re requiring I be premium to customize the message. It feels like a pure money play. I now just accept everyone and then wait for them to reach out, then I remove connection if it’s a bot—so many are and my middle initial in my name is a giveaway—or if it’s totally irrelevant or salesy. Yet for people who actually are thoughtful and might be a good network for me, it’s lost in the mess. I wish LinkedIn focused more on the consumer less on whether they’re gonna buy the mega expensive limited value premium plan. 

I’d pay $5 or $20 a month for something that just helped me search better, or a personal AI recruiter that would understand who I want to find and curate a bunch of matches. You have the network, I suggest you build utility to drive revenue, not limit custom messages in connection requests to drive marginal upside.

title: Fraudulently started subscription
text: I simply don’t really use this app. Somehow a subscription was started for $52 a month!! Apple will only refund that last two charges. It went unnoticed because I never set it up. This is unacceptable and a scam being done by LinkedIn. Terrible business practices. Deleting this app.

title: Nice app but needs polishing.
text:
“Top Applicant” and “Message the job poster” icons in Jobs list are confusingly identical design and color and very obviously should not be and make it difficult to identify Top Applicant positions in a Jobs list.

Add filtering. Such as salary comparison and/or filtering mechanism +X% or -X% integrating the impact of state taxes on current location and pay, when provided.

title: Unacceptable performance
text: This app is optimized terribly. Every other search is freezing and the app has basically become unusable with the amount of times it will freeze or crash. I’m using an iPhone 15 so it’s not like I’m using old hardware either.

title: STILL CAN’T GET IT RIGHT
text: Even after 5 updates, the app still makes my phone freeze up or restart everytime I go to use it. Love the service, HATE the app. With all the people who use the app, you’d think they could find a decent programer.

title: Steep Subscription
text:
I have to pay $40 a month to be able to do my own research in Linked in. For example if I want to evaluate how efficient certain certification or training is I want to find out what people who took it were able to accomplish afterwards. Linked in does not show the results, but instead grays those out under a big fat nagging that you need a subscription. I cannot afford $40 a month!!! And I only need to use this for 1 time a year… 
This is a rip off!!!!

title: Glitchy
text: The app is so glitchy. If you click on a job posting and try to scroll after clicking it malfunctions with fail almost every time. See it for yourself.

title: Trash
text: Seven years on this app...not ONE single job...you better off looking on Craigslist over this crappy app

title: Access Restriction
text: LinkedIn suddenly logged me out of my account, I have tried to login in several times, I keep getting Access restriction message,The effort to reach out to their customer support on very platform prove abortive, please kindly look into this issue. I can’t afford to lose my account.

title: App still broken
text: Unable to navigate app during setup. App continues to freeze.

title: Fraud.
text: This App is fraudulent. They block and restrict your account after collecting your subscription funds. Very criminal minded App. They’re nothing but criminals extorting money from innocent people. Please don’t use this App for any reason. I am a victim. They don’t refund after they deceive you into subscribing to their premium services.

title: I used to love LinkedIn
text:
I loved LinkedIn, it is actually the reason I have the job I do right now. I’ve currently started looking for jobs in a career I’m going to school for but for some reason LinkedIn has started allowing businesses to Spam job listing and it’s irritating. No matter how many times I block the postings there’s more and more from the same two companies and they are for REVIEWS AND SURVEYS not even real jobs. 

Since this has started my app runs extremely slow as well, won’t even let me scroll have the time.

title: It's irritating
text: I don't know why giving right captcha when logged in have still problem!?its says no captcha or invalid,what to do?

title: Job Search and Posting Improvements
text:
Ideas for job search-

Allow to search/filter for location within a company. Where “remote” and “hybrid” are options under location. Then, show all of the locations available in the filter and so you can pick multiple locations, including remote and hybrid. Or, make a completely separate filter for location that lists all locations of jobs posted in that company. 

For the job poster- 

make it a clear distinction for them to select when a position is “remote anywhere” vs “remote but you need to live within a certain city, state, country”. As a seeker, I can see “remote” but I don’t know if there are still location restrictions on that. It might say New York, but I have to read the details to see the remote specifics. (If they’re there.)

title: Cannot received email
text: Never ever received any code or email from you. Blocked my account with no reason.

title: Contact jasspar for support
text: Hello please if anyone having issues with his LinkedIn verification or account please kindly contact jasspar🙏

title: Crash into me
text: All this app does is crash. I’ve tried uninstalling and reinstalling it. My OS is up to date. I don’t have trouble with any other apps. It’s just LinkedIn that crashes every time I open it. Good stuff.

title: Block my account for no reason
text: I have registered Linkedin for several times, but every time my account will be permanently blocked, it is so annoying and it has messed up my life, especially for whom is finding a job.

title: Fine, could be better
text: It’s basically work Facebook at this point. Everyone plays up their accomplishments, and assume you have the same regressive, pro-corporate, anti-employee political views they do, just without the profanity you’d find on Facebook. You’ll see ever more irrelevant job postings for laughably low wages that expect you to move across the country. I can’t stress this enough; the jobs tab has gotten progressively worse with each update. I tried their Premium service, and was still inundated with jobs in the wrong geographic area, with recruiters who don’t call back even if it says I’m a top match. I can’t imagine anyone justifying $39.99 per month for this.

title: The app is hanging very bad
text: The app is hanging very bad

title: Can’t login/change password
text: I’m assisting someone in recruiting for a startup and they’ve made it nearly impossible to do that. The email the account is registered under is no longer active and since they have no recovery methods set up they can’t change it. None of the recommended recovery methods work. Customer support is non existent and is so hard to find that it feels very intentional. I also left a 1 star review earlier that is mysteriously no longer visible. Maybe I’ll be able to actually get in touch with someone after they see this (if they don’t remove it first). It’s absolutely ridiculous that it’s they’ve made a simple process this difficult.

title: Do Better…
text:
LinkedIn needs to do better, it is riddled with fake job postings. 
Out of 76 jobs listed in the past 24 hours, only 3 looked valid, this app is not worth it for people looking for a job. 

I only recommend this app if you want to circle jerk liking/posting content for attention.

title: Keyboard Lag in Search Bar
text: Typing is painfully slow when using the search function to the point of being unusable. Please fix ASAP.

title: Too many notifications/emails
text:
Had heard this was the way to look for jobs but so far I’m just getting a lot of messages and/or notifications that end up being nothing more than a waste of my time - will
more than likely being deleting it soon!

title: Freeze and frequent crashing
text: Awful app! Constantly freezes, followed by a crash. It’s garbage content packed with ads, sponsored posts, and AI made push content they call “Suggested Posts”! There is so much irrelevant Instagram quality content on LinkedIn feed that one forgets this is supposed to be professional and work related content.

title: Captcha Error; Can’t Log In
text: The security captcha just loops and won’t let me in my account. Pitiful, LinkedIn. Pitiful.

title: Too expensive
text: LinkedIn Premier for Career is $40 PER MONTH!!  A complete rip off!!  The extras are not worth $40 a month.

text:
- i can't download my saved CV, just preview it.
- App starts bugging and stops reacting after some time when i try to apply for a job and opens popup window.

title: Unoptimized for iPhone 14
text: The lag when searching for people is just insane!

title: Sign in issues too much
text: Why lies saying “we have sent a message to your number “,while you never sent any

title: Hacked!
text: Completely unnecessary to use LinkedIn if they cannot protect your information

title: Charge you for premium service. You never get it.
text:
I used to love logging into LinkedIn to see What my professional network was announcing, who was moving where, and keeping up-to-date with all of the new product announcements. The new algorithms allow all the “influencers” to push never ending promotions to everyone, but should you want to announce a new product launch and copy paste it to 3 groups, you will be classified as breaking the rules and using third-party software and thereby blocked. 
It has basically become unusable for a small business to announce product launches, as even if you copy paste, something you’ll be classified as using automated third-party software and breaking the rules. 
I’m pretty sure every big company won’t be struggling with this issue, but the small guy is as always screwed. 
I have tried to contact customer service, 11 times in the three weeks that I have been blocked, and yet they don’t answer, but still happy to charge me for the premium service.

title: Full of Scammers
text: This app/site is full of scammers trying to get personal information from people. What is LinkedIn doing to prevent things like this. Avoid people who do “email interviews”

title: Crazy freezing
text: This app is just ridiculous when it glitches with every version update, it's just unbelievable. For example, when you scroll through contacts to add them to your list, you add and expand your database, and as soon as you literally scroll down to the bottom of the page, the phone starts freezing terribly, and then you can't collapse the app or turn it off. You have to forcibly shut down the phone because the app blocks any action at all. The feed behaves similarly, and my iPhone XS Max just hangs. You have obvious performance issues, and most likely there's a cache bug because the more we browse through the contact or post feed results, the phone definitely freezes, which is no longer like an iPhone but a glitchy Android. Also, I suspect that the problem lies in the fact that when adding contacts, the notification of successful addition is cached every time, and this creates a queue for other notifications, and until the notification cache is cleared, it just crashes the device in hard freeze.

title: PLEASE fix the job search filters.
text: It’s so annoying to look at jobs for a particular company, only to have the company filter reset to ALL companies as soon as one starts to filter on geography.

title: Messy and unprofessional looking
text: I find it difficult to navigate around the website. There is too much going on and do we really need to be congratulating people for work anniversaries?!? We don’t need to be wishing people happy birthday, there are other apps for that. It seems to be trying to act like Facebook and not be something that stands on its own.

title: Fix the left pane
text: The left pane that shows the profile settings, groups, your pages, and profiles causes the app to lock up or freeze. This has been an ongoing issue for months and is annoying. The only time it works is if you’re a premium user.

title: Notifications Not Showing Up
text: Get the red balloon alert that I have a notification, but once I click on the bell, the page is blank.

title: Confuse on  what I’m really paying for
text: I thought LinkedIn was a place where you can connect and companies can see your résumé. Maybe you can connect with other people that work in your same field and you can see job openings however, you guys want me to pay to see the list of jobs why would I pay to see a list of jobs this not even a guarantee that I would get. then it also said that it would put my résumé at the top if I pay, but I would think the company that is using you to help them find people to apply would want the person with the best résumé in the most like the best experience and qualifications for whatever job that they’re looking to to fill, and you’re going to put whoever pays the most money at the top

title: Full of scammers
text:
This app is nowadays full of scammers and people using it as Tinder! But when you report it to the “safety team” despite proving evidence they not only don’t do anything but says “it doesn’t go against our community rules”.

Paying for a premium account will just make your mail box full of scammers messages and zero support from this app!
